name: Tactical Data Link Management System (TDLMS)
description: HAVELSAN offers Tactical Data Link Management System (TDLMS) to perform the planning and management of the Tactical Data Links deployed on military platforms and command centers from a single center. TDLMS allows the formation of centers that can back-up each other and perform tasks interchangeably each other. Contain productive tools, ensures decrease overwork and provides user-friendly interface to enable the effective operation of the TDL management cycle consist of Multilink Planning (APP-11 OPTASKLINK BaseLine 15), Network Design (NETMAN T1), Planning and Design Verification Simulation, Dynamic Network Management, Post-Mission Analysis. Provides a portable TDLMS to support the off-site TDL management activities. TDLMS ensures required data in the required way, support operational success and assists minimizing the military casualties.

name: ITA C2DNEVO
description: C2DNEVO Commando e Controllo Digitalizzato di Navigazione EVOluto (Advanced Digital Navigation Command and Control)  Tactical C2 system implementing the ADatP-36(A)(2), the ADatP-36(B) and the VMF 6017B protocol, allows the vehicle to share the LOP with other systems exchanging positions and other graphical objects and messages. The system is also capable of battle space management and terrain analysis by using several Geo tools, instant and formatted messaging exchange.

name: T-PKI
description: Tactical PKI - The system allows the provision of encryption, signature and authentication software certificates to technical or physical entities, using dedicated and customizable certification offers. Hardware certificates (on smart cards) are excluded from the initial scope of the product. The life cycle of the certificates is entirely managed by the system (initial request, renewal, revocation, recovery)  The product is divided in several racks dedicated to a core function of the system, allowing it to be highly customizable to match the specifics of each field of operation. Multiple confidentiality levels can be addressed within the system, due to its modularity and the many certification authorities that can be declined from the trust chain, which key elements are stored and managed directly from the remote core sovereign PKI.  It includes a decentralized certification authority of the chosen level provided by the sovereign PKI, and allows the provision of software certificates t

name: DEU SMC
description: DEU SMC Spiral 4 - IBM v1.1 SFN are fulllfilled with the products  DIPS 5.2 The DEU Interoperability Platform Service (DIPS) is the SMC Information Exchange Service (SMC IES). It is responsible for the communication with SMC systems of other nations and the multinational exchange of SMC data. DIPS provides standardised SMC interfaces for this purpose. Conceptionally, DIPS realises the exchange of Service Management and Control information within a federated network environment. It is responsible for the multinational communication and the federated exchange of SMC data in accordance with the Service Management and Control interface standard for the federation of CIS SMC data. In this respect, DIPS serves as a translation layer between the national SMC backend system and federated SMC peer units.  IBM Maximo Application Suite incl. name: MDLP (Multi Data Link Processor)
description: he M-DLP (Multi Data Link Processor) system is to provide the feature to exchange real time data that mainly consist of sensors generated information, units position, weapon system status and command orders, via multiple Data Links. It provides a common, interoperable, scalable link integration solution for all platforms (air, surface, land). The M-DLP manages different Data Links protocol: Link 11; Link 16; Link 22; JREAP-C; VMF. The M-DLP includes an embedded simulation capability through a specific DIS/HLA interface. The M-DLP provides Standard Interface for Multiple Platform Link Evaluation (SIMPLE) to guarantee participation to simulated link networks.

name: Outlook Labelling Add-In
description: The "Outlook Labeling Add-In" you mentioned is designed to facilitate compliance with NATO standards‚Äîspecifically NATO STANAGs 4774 and 4778‚Äîfor email classification and metadata labeling.  Here's a clear explanation of its purpose and functionality:  Purpose The Koch IT Outlook Plugin is designed to help users apply and handle security classification labels on emails according to NATO standards (STANAG 4774 and 4778). This ensures secure and standardized email communications within NATO missions and among member nations or partner nations.  NATO Standards STANAG 4774 outlines confidentiality metadata labeling, detailing how emails and attachments should be labeled to denote their confidentiality level and other pertinent metadata such as the governing security policy, classification level (e.g., UNCLASSIFIED, RESTRICTED), and dissemination constraints (e.g., "Releasable to FIN, SWE"). STANAG 4778 complements STANAG 4774, defining the mechanisms for verifying and enforcing these cl
